com.inn.headstartdemo.utils

Class QueryObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inn.headstartdemo.utils.QueryObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class QueryObject
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    The QueryObject is used to pass search parameters to the DAO layer. This is an encapsulation of search criteria, which is interpreted by underlying DAO implementer to construct a query. By having all the search parameters in one place (the QueryObject), this prevents combinatory explosion of 'find' method signatures viz findByXXX in the DAO/Service layer. This leads to a more stable DAO/Service interfaces as one can add search parameters to the QueryObject without adding new methods to interfaces. QueryObject helps you drive your search in the following areas:
    • Configure the search mode (EQUALS, LIKE, ...)
    • Pagination: it allows to limit search results to a specific range.
    • Allows to specify ORDER BY and ASC/DESC
    • Simple support for date range search criteria
    • Named query: if you set a named query, it will be executed
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
